segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client management requires custom Group Policy settings to be applied.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client management requires custom Group Policy settings to be applied.

segment.source: This topic describes the available policy options for Group Policy Object (GPO) when you use MBAM to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption in the enterprise.
segment.target: This topic describes the available policy options for Group Policy Object (GPO) when you use MBAM to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption in the enterprise.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: MBAM does not use the default GPO settings for Windows BitLocker drive encryption.
segment.target: MBAM does not use the default GPO settings for Windows BitLocker drive encryption.

segment.source: If the default settings are enabled, they can cause conflicting behavior.
segment.target: If the default settings are enabled, they can cause conflicting behavior.

segment.source: To enable MBAM to manage BitLocker, you must define the GPO policy settings after you install the MBAM Group Policy Template.
segment.target: To enable MBAM to manage BitLocker, you must define the GPO policy settings after you install the MBAM Group Policy Template.

segment.source: After you install the MBAM Group Policy template, you can view and modify the available custom MBAM GPO policy settings that enable MBAM to manage the enterprise BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: After you install the MBAM Group Policy template, you can view and modify the available custom MBAM GPO policy settings that enable MBAM to manage the enterprise BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: The MBAM Group Policy template must be installed on a computer that is capable of running the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) MDOP technology.
segment.target: The MBAM Group Policy template must be installed on a computer that is capable of running the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) MDOP technology.

segment.source: Next, to edit the applicable GPO, open the GPMC or AGPM, and then navigate to the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).
segment.target: Next, to edit the applicable GPO, open the GPMC or AGPM, and then navigate to the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).

segment.source: The MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) GPO node contains four global policy settings and four child GPO setting nodes, respectively.
segment.target: The MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) GPO node contains four global policy settings and four child GPO setting nodes, respectively.

segment.source: The four GPO global policy settings are: Client Management, Fixed Drive, Operating System Drive, and Removable Drive.
segment.target: The four GPO global policy settings are: Client Management, Fixed Drive, Operating System Drive, and Removable Drive.

segment.source: The following sections provide policy definitions and suggested policy settings to help you plan for the MBAM GPO policy setting requirements.
segment.target: The following sections provide policy definitions and suggested policy settings to help you plan for the MBAM GPO policy setting requirements.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about configuring the minimum suggested GPO settings to enable MBAM to manage BitLocker encryption, see How to Edit MBAM 1.0 GPO Settings.
segment.target: For more information about configuring the minimum suggested GPO settings to enable MBAM to manage BitLocker encryption, see How to Edit MBAM 1.0 GPO Settings.

segment.source: Allow hardware compatibility checking
segment.target: Allow hardware compatibility checking

segment.source: Suggested Configuration: Enabled
segment.target: Suggested Configuration: Enabled

segment.source: This policy setting lets you manage the verification of hardware compatibility before you enable BitLocker protection on drives of MBAM client computers.
segment.target: This policy setting lets you manage the verification of hardware compatibility before you enable BitLocker protection on drives of MBAM client computers.

segment.source: You should enable this policy option if your enterprise has older computer hardware or computers that do not support Trusted Platform Module (TPM).
segment.target: You should enable this policy option if your enterprise has older computer hardware or computers that do not support Trusted Platform Module (TPM).

segment.source: If either of these criteria is true, enable the hardware compatibility verification to make sure that MBAM is applied only to computer models that support BitLocker.
segment.target: If either of these criteria is true, enable the hardware compatibility verification to make sure that MBAM is applied only to computer models that support BitLocker.

segment.source: If all computers in your organization support BitLocker, you do not have to deploy the Hardware Compatibility, and you can set this policy to Not Configured.
segment.target: If all computers in your organization support BitLocker, you do not have to deploy the Hardware Compatibility, and you can set this policy to Not Configured.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, the model of the computer is validated against the hardware compatibility list once every 24 hours, before the policy enables BitLocker protection on a computer drive.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, the model of the computer is validated against the hardware compatibility list once every 24 hours, before the policy enables BitLocker protection on a computer drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before enabling this policy setting, make sure that you have configured the MBAM Recovery and Hardware service endpoint setting in the Configure MBAM Services policy options.
segment.target: Before enabling this policy setting, make sure that you have configured the MBAM Recovery and Hardware service endpoint setting in the Configure MBAM Services policy options.

segment.source: If you either disable or do not configure this policy setting, the computer model is not validated against the hardware compatibility list.
segment.target: If you either disable or do not configure this policy setting, the computer model is not validated against the hardware compatibility list.

segment.target: Suggested Configuration: Not Configured

segment.source: Enable this policy to unlock and view the fixed drives that are formatted with the (FAT) file system on computers that are running Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows XP with SP3, or Windows XP with SP2.
segment.target: Enable this policy to unlock and view the fixed drives that are formatted with the (FAT) file system on computers that are running Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows XP with SP3, or Windows XP with SP2.

segment.source: These operating systems have read-only permissions to BitLocker-protected drives.
segment.target: These operating systems have read-only permissions to BitLocker-protected drives.

segment.source: When the policy is disabled, removable drives formatted with the FAT file system cannot be unlocked and their content cannot be viewed on computers that are running Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows XP with SP3, or Windows XP with SP2.
segment.target: When the policy is disabled, removable drives formatted with the FAT file system cannot be unlocked and their content cannot be viewed on computers that are running Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows XP with SP3, or Windows XP with SP2.

segment.source: Configure the use of password for removable data drives
segment.target: Configure the use of password for removable data drives

segment.source: Suggested configuration: Not Configured
segment.target: Suggested configuration: Not Configured

segment.source: Enable this policy to configure password protection on removable data drives.
segment.target: Enable this policy to configure password protection on removable data drives.

segment.source: When this policy is not configured, passwords are supported with the default settings, which do not include password complexity requirements and require only eight characters.
segment.target: When this policy is not configured, passwords are supported with the default settings, which do not include password complexity requirements and require only eight characters.

segment.source: For increased security, you can enable this policy and select Require password for removable data drive, select Require password complexity, and then set the preferred minimum password length.
segment.target: For increased security, you can enable this policy and select Require password for removable data drive, select Require password complexity, and then set the preferred minimum password length.

segment.source: Choose how BitLocker-protected removable drives can be recovered
segment.target: Choose how BitLocker-protected removable drives can be recovered

segment.source: Suggested Configuration: Not Configured
segment.target: Suggested Configuration: Not Configured

segment.source: You can configure this policy to enable the BitLocker data recovery agent or to save BitLocker recovery information to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
segment.target: You can configure this policy to enable the BitLocker data recovery agent or to save BitLocker recovery information to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

segment.source: When the policy is set to Not Configured, the data recovery agent is allowed and recovery information is not backed up to AD DS.
segment.target: When the policy is set to Not Configured, the data recovery agent is allowed and recovery information is not backed up to AD DS.

segment.source: MBAM operation does not require the recovery information to be backed up to AD DS.
segment.target: MBAM operation does not require the recovery information to be backed up to AD DS.
